Package com.hoddmimes.distributor

Class DistributorApplicationConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hoddmimes.distributor.DistributorApplicationConfiguration
  • public class DistributorApplicationConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
    An DistributorApplicationConfiguration object specifies global settings for a Distributor. The parameter context is passed as parameter to the Distributor constructor when being created. Parameters should be set before the instance is passed to the creation of an "Distributor" instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DistributorApplicationConfiguration

        public DistributorApplicationConfiguration​(java.lang.String pApplicationName)
        Constructor for creating an application configuration instance. A global parameters and setting used by the Distributor and its components are wrapped in a DistributorApplicationConfiguration object. Parameters are static in the sense that they must be set before the object is passed to the Distributor constructor. Changing parameters after creating the Distributor object will not have any effects, with one exception;
        SetLogFlags could be changed dynamically.

        Default logging enabled is:
        • LOG_ERROR_EVENTS logging of application events signaled to subscribers and publishers
        • LOG_CONNECTION_EVENTS create and delete of distributor connections
        • LOG_RETRANSMISSION_EVENTS tracing of retransmission and recovery events
        • LOG_RMTDB_EVENTS creation and deletion of remote distributor connections

        Parameters:
        pApplicationName - name of the application. Used used for identification and tracing purpose, must not be null.
        Throws:
        DistributorException - exception thrown if failed to create an instance

    • Method Detail

      • isLogFlagEnabled

        public boolean isLogFlagEnabled​(int pLogFlag)
        Check whatever a specific log flag is enabled.
        Parameters:
        pLogFlag - log flag to be checked
        Returns:
        true is log flag is enabled, otherwise false

      • setLogToFile

        public void setLogToFile​(boolean pLogToFileFlag)
        By default a specific distributor log file is created in the working directory. The distributor will write its event to the log file. It is possible to disable creation and logging to the log file by passing false to the method.
        Parameters:
        pLogToFileFlag - enable / disable creation and logging to file.

      • isLogToFileEnabled

        public boolean isLogToFileEnabled()
        Check whatever a specific distributor log file is to be created and used.
        Returns:
        true if logging is enabled, otherwise false.

      • setLogToConsole

        public void setLogToConsole​(boolean pLogToConsoleFlag)
        By default the distributor will log its output to stdout and stderr. It is possible to turn of the console logging to stdout and stderr by passing false to the method
        Parameters:
        pLogToConsoleFlag - turn console logging on / off

      • isLogToConsoleEnabled

        public boolean isLogToConsoleEnabled()
        Check whatever logging to stdout and stderr should take place or not.
        Returns:
        true if logging is enabled, otherwise false

      • setLogFlags

        public void setLogFlags​(int pLogFlags)
        Sets the log mask filtering what distributor events being logged to the log file The log mask values are
        • LOG_ERROR_EVENTS, trace when application error events are passed to the publisher / subscriber event callback routines.
        • LOG_CONNECTION_EVENTS, trace the creation and deletion of distributor connection instances
        • LOG_RMTDB_EVENTS, trace the creation and deletion of remote distributor connection
        • LOG_RETRANSMISSION_EVENTS, trace retransmission requests and recovery events
        • LOG_SUBSCRIPTION_EVENTS, trace when subscribers add and remove subscriptions
        • LOG_STATISTIC_EVENTS, periodically out statistics information to the log file in case statistic tracing is enabled.
        • LOG_SEGMENTS_EVENTS, trace when sending and receiving packages (can be extensive).
        • LOG_DATA_PROTOCOL_RCV, trace distributor protocol messages received.
        • int LOG_DATA_PROTOCOL_XTA, trace distributor protocol messages sent.
        • int LOG_RETRANSMISSION_CACHE, periodically trace the size and time span of the messages in the retransmission cache.
        Parameters:
        pLogFlags - to be enabled. Values are "OR" together

      • getLogFlags

        public int getLogFlags()
        Returns the log flags enabled
        Returns:
        int, log flag mask value

      • setEthDevice

        public void setEthDevice​(java.lang.String pEthDevice)
        The distributor will identify itself with its local IP address with interacting with other distributors. The address used will be retrieved from the ethernet device specified . By default "eth0" is used. On windows that will be the first ethernet device having a IP V4 address set.
        Parameters:
        pEthDevice - to retrieve the IP address from

      • getEthDevice

        public java.lang.String getEthDevice()
        Returns the ethernet device to retrieve the IP address from
        Returns:
        ethernet device string, like "eth0"

      • setLocalHostAddress

        public void setLocalHostAddress​(java.lang.String pLocalHostAddress)
        It is possible to set the local IP address used for identification. When specifying a IP address the distributor will address supplied instead of trying to retrieve it from the ethernet device specified.
        Parameters:
        pLocalHostAddress - address string to be used "xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx"

      • getLocalHostAddress

        public java.lang.String getLocalHostAddress()
        Returns the IP addressed used for identification when iteracting with other distributors.
        Returns:
        address string to be used "xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx"

      • isMgmtControlEnabled

        public boolean isMgmtControlEnabled()
        Returns whatever the Distributor management control multicast group is to be started or not. When being started counters and values can be viewed locally or remotely via the Distributor Viewer application.
        Returns:
        boolean, flag indicating whatever the Distributor management port is to be started or not.

      • setMgmtControlEnabled

        public void setMgmtControlEnabled​(boolean pEnableControl)
        Enable/disable start of Distributor management control transport (for this application) By default the transport is disabled.
        Parameters:
        pEnableControl - true if enabling management control transport

      • setCMAInterface

        public void setCMAInterface​(java.lang.String pCMAInterfaceAddress)
        Setting the network interface on which the management control transport is to be enabled. By default the transport is enabled on all interfaces.
        Parameters:
        pCMAInterfaceAddress - , configuration multicast address interface address

      • getCMAInterface

        public java.lang.String getCMAInterface()

        Returns:

      • getTimerThreads

        public int getTimerThreads()
        Returns the number of timer threads that should be started. The recommended value is 2. In case of many connections being created it could be applicable to started 1 or 2 more timer threads.
        Returns:
        int, number of timer threads that will be started

      • setTimerThreads

        public void setTimerThreads​(int pValue)
        Sets the number of timer threads that will be started. The recommended value is 2. In case of many connections being created it could be applicable to started 1 or 2 more timer threads. By default two threads are started. This should be sufficient.
        Parameters:
        pValue - , number of timer threads to activate

      • getApplicationName

        public java.lang.String getApplicationName()
        Returns the application name set used to identification and tracing purpose.
        Returns:
        - application name string

      • isBroadcastGateayUseEnabled

        public boolean isBroadcastGateayUseEnabled()
        Check whatever the broadcast gateway should be used by this process. If being used the application is interested in data published application on remote sites and being forwarded by the broadcast gateway using a p-2-p transport i.e. tcp/ip
        Returns:
        true broadcast gateway use is enabled

        Returns:
        the IP address string of the host where the bdxgwy will run

      • setIsBroadcastGateway

        public void setIsBroadcastGateway​(boolean pFlag)
        Set whatever the application using the Distributor is a broadcast gateway or not. Note! By default the value is false and you should leave it that way, trust me.
        Parameters:
        pFlag -

      • isBroadcastGateway

        public boolean isBroadcastGateway()
        Check whatever the application is a broadcast gateway or not.
        Returns:
        true if being a bdxgwy otherwise false.
